text: benchmarks set out the maximum allowable emissions of NOx and particulate matter based on the size and use class of the proposed development. There are two sets of benchmarks covering the main two sources of air pollution from new developments: z Building Emissions Benchmark (BEB) – emissions from equipment used to supply heat and energy to the buildings; and z Transport Emissions Benchmark (TEB) – emissions from private vehicles travelling to and from the development. 13.119 Both benchmarks must be achieved for a development proposal to be considered air quality neutral. Applicants should refer to the Air Quality Positive LPG and Air Quality Neutral LPG for further guidance.
